FuncDef:
The radius-server accounting cache retransmit command configures an interval at which cached RADIUS accounting packets are retransmitted and the number of users for each packet retransmission.
The undo radius-server accounting cache retransmit command restores the default configuration.
The default interval at which cached RADIUS accounting packets are retransmitted and the default number of users for each packet retransmission are 10s and 1, respectively.
By default,theinterval at which cached RADIUS accounting packets are retransmitted and the default number of users for each packet retransmission are 10s and 1, respectively.
CLIs: undo radius-server accounting cache retransmit [ retransmit timeout <timeout> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the number of users for each packet retransmission.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 30. The default value is 1.

Specifies an interval at which cached RADIUS accounting packets are retransmitted.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 10, in seconds. The default value is 10.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If a large value is configured for the maximum number of accounting packets that can be cached in the radius-server accounting cache max-packet-number command, you can run the radius-server accounting cache retransmit command to configure an interval at which cached RADIUS accounting packets are retransmitted and the number of users for each packet retransmission, improving packet transmission performance.
Configuration Impact
After the radius-server accounting cache retransmit command is run, cached RADIUS accounting packets of the number of users specified by retransmit are retransmitted at the interval specified by timeout.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
